Name: MOBIFLOW via SECSM
Description: O-RAN E2SM-based audit stream generating fine-grained L3 telemetry from CU/DU; validated on testbed. [Testbed]
Target Components / Interfaces: O-CU, O-DU, Near-RT RIC, E2 Interface, F1 Interface
Reference: 5G-SPECTOR: An O-RAN Compliant Layer-3 Cellular Attack Detection Service

Name: MOBIEXPERT xApp IDS
Description: P-BEST rule-based xApp detects 7 L3 attacks; scaled to 11 variants and 31 traces with low overhead. [Testbed]
Reference: 5G-SPECTOR: An O-RAN Compliant Layer-3 Cellular Attack Detection Service

Name: Digital targeted PGD
Description: White-box attack perturbing xApp GNN inputs via softmax-targeted PGD to overload cells. [Testbed]
Reference: Enhancing O-RAN Security: Evasion Attacks and Robust Defenses for Graph Reinforcement Learning-based Connection Management

Name: Physical PGD on RSRP
Description: Over-the-air jamming perturbs UEs‚Äô RSRP within PNR bound; white/black-box optimization evaluated. [Testbed]
Reference: Enhancing O-RAN Security: Evasion Attacks and Robust Defenses for Graph Reinforcement Learning-based Connection Management

Name: Patch physical attack
Description: Mask-limited jamming perturbs only a subset of UEs‚Äô RSRP; observed coverage drops. [Testbed]
Reference: Enhancing O-RAN Security: Evasion Attacks and Robust Defenses for Graph Reinforcement Learning-based Connection Management

Name: Adversarial training Graph based
Description: Fine-tunes DQN with PGD-perturbed trajectories across PNR budgets; restores ~15% coverage under physical attacks. [Testbed]
Reference: Enhancing O-RAN Security: Evasion Attacks and Robust Defenses for Graph Reinforcement Learning-based Connection Management

Name: C-Plane DoS Attacker
Description: Linux tool flooding eCPRI C-Plane packets; validated on DU-RU testbed, showing U-Plane loss at O-DU/O-RU across traffic rates. [Testbed]
Reference: Development of C-plane DoS attacker for O-RAN FHI

Name: Anomaly Traffic Detector (ATD)
Description: Custom ATD inspects UPF traffic, classifies anomalies with Random Forest; drives xApp decisions; evaluated on OAI/FlexRIC testbed. [Testbed]
Reference: AI-Driven Network Intrusion Detection and Resource Allocation in Real-World O-RAN 5G Networks

Name: OAITT A1 Security Testing Tool
Description: Open-source tool testing A1 TLS/Oauth, fuzzing, tampering, and DoS; evaluated on ŒºONOS and OSC. [Code]
Reference: Security Testing The O-RAN Near-Real Time RIC \& A1 Interface

Name: A1 Policy Tampering Attack
Description: Malicious Non-RT RIC modifies or deletes another's A1 policies; demonstrated against ŒºONOS with message sequence. [Testbed]
Target Components / Interfaces: Near-RT RIC, A1 Interface, Non-RT RIC
Reference: Security Testing The O-RAN Near-Real Time RIC \& A1 Interface

Name: Malicious xApp attack
Description: xApp perturbs spectrogram/KPM test data to mislead inference; evaluated causing network degradation on OTA O-RAN testbed. [Testbed]
Reference: System-level Analysis of Adversarial Attacks and Defenses on Intelligence in O-RAN based Cellular Networks

Name: Distillation defense
Description: Teacher-student distillation with high/low softmax temperatures; deployed within xApp; restores accuracy against adversarial data attacks in near-RT RIC. [Testbed]
Reference: System-level Analysis of Adversarial Attacks and Defenses on Intelligence in O-RAN based Cellular Networks

Name: Adversarial training
Description: Augments training with adversarial examples (epsilon 0.02) and evaluates robustness versus attacks under near-RT constraints. [Testbed]
Reference: System-level Analysis of Adversarial Attacks and Defenses on Intelligence in O-RAN based Cellular Networks

Name: MOBIWATCH anomaly detector
Description: Unsupervised xApp detects anomalous sequences; achieved 100% recall across five attacks in testbed. [Testbed]
Reference: 6G-XSec: Explainable Edge Security for Emerging OpenRAN Architectures

Name: LLM expert referencing
Description: LLM xApp classifies and explains anomalies using prompt templates; evaluated across multiple LLMs. [Testbed]
Reference: 6G-XSec: Explainable Edge Security for Emerging OpenRAN Architectures

Name: OAI UE-based RRC Fuzzer
Description: Injection fuzzer on OAI UE mutates or generates RRC/NAS before PDCP; demonstrated in O-RAN lab with packet captures. [Testbed]
Target Components / Interfaces: UE, Airlink, O-CU, O-DU, F1 Interface
Reference: 5G/O-RAN Security Automated Testing

Name: IDSx xApp
Description: Self-attention RNN autoencoder detects intrusions; trained and tested on wireless attack scenarios; demonstrated jamming detection. [Testbed]
Reference: Advancing O-RAN Security: Integrated Intrusion Detection and Secure Slicing xApps

Name: Secure Slicing xApp
Description: Dynamically isolates malicious UEs to low-resource slice via E2 control, suppressing throughput after IDS alerts. [Testbed]
Reference: Advancing O-RAN Security: Integrated Intrusion Detection and Secure Slicing xApps

Name: Anomaly Traffic Detector
Description: Real-time detector using state machine and conformance checks; blocks malformed, out-of-sequence, and DoS traffic; validated via fuzzer and O-RAN tests. [Testbed]
Target Components / Interfaces: Near-RT RIC, E2 Interface, xApps, O-CU, O-DU
Reference: Anomaly Detection for Mitigating xApp and E2 Interface Threats in O-RAN Near-RT RIC

Name: State Machine Analysis Module
Description: FSM validates E2AP/xApp signaling order; blocks illegal sequences and RMR spoofing; demonstrated preventing CVE-2023-41628/41627 impacts. [Testbed]
Reference: Anomaly Detection for Mitigating xApp and E2 Interface Threats in O-RAN Near-RT RIC

Name: Conformance Check Module
Description: Validates packet formats and monitors traffic rates; blocks malformed RMR/E2AP and mitigates DoS; prevented CVE-2023-40997/40998 crashes. [Testbed]
Reference: Anomaly Detection for Mitigating xApp and E2 Interface Threats in O-RAN Near-RT RIC

Name: E2/RMR Fuzzer
Description: Generates randomized, mutated RMR and E2AP packets from xApps/E2 nodes to stress and exploit targets; triggered multiple CVEs in evaluation. [Testbed]
Reference: Anomaly Detection for Mitigating xApp and E2 Interface Threats in O-RAN Near-RT RIC

Name: TrustORAN Zero-Trust
Description: Blockchain zero-trust for xApp authentication/authorization; implemented on private/public blockchains with performance evaluation. [Code]
Reference: Blockchain Meets O-RAN: A Decentralized Zero-Trust Framework for Secure and Resilient O-RAN in 6G and Beyond

Name: Access Control Contracts
Description: Smart-contract ACCs enforce per-xApp policies and tokens; PEP verifies signatures and validity before granting access. [Code]
Reference: Blockchain Meets O-RAN: A Decentralized Zero-Trust Framework for Secure and Resilient O-RAN in 6G and Beyond

Name: Conflict Mitigation Framework (CMF)
Description: Near-RT RIC framework with CD/CR agents to detect and resolve all xApp conflict types; validated via O-RAN network simulation. [Testbed]
Reference: Conflict Mitigation Framework and Conflict Detection in O-RAN Near-RT RIC

Name: UE RBS detector (stability ML)
Description: Android UE ML detector using SSB signal-stability (std. deviation); evaluated >99% accuracy on operational and rogue BS datasets. [Testbed]
Reference: Developing xApps for Rogue Base Station Detection in SDR-Enabled O-RAN

Name: OZTrust access control
Description: Per-packet tagging and verification using xApp-specific contexts; verification at xApp VIF; prototype prevents unauthorized API use and lateral movement. [Testbed]
Reference: OZTrust: An O-RAN Zero-Trust Security System

Name: Bearer Migration Poisoning (BMP)
Description: Poison RIC to trigger false bearer migration; causes blackholes  ~10√ó signalling cost and ‚âà0 Mbps throughput. [Testbed]
Target Components / Interfaces: Near-RT RIC, O-CU,  O-DU,  xApps,  E2 Interface, E1 Interface, F1 Interface
Reference: Poisoning Bearer Context Migration in O-RAN 5G Network

Name: XRF xApp security framework
Description: OAuth2-based authentication, authorization, and service discovery for xApps; implemented and evaluated on a Kubernetes microservice testbed. [Testbed]
Reference: Securing 5G OpenRAN with a Scalable Authorization Framework for xApps

Name: Remote token introspection
Description: Validates JWTs by forwarding tokens to the server‚Äôs introspection endpoint, which checks and returns validity. [Code]
Reference: Securing 5G OpenRAN with a Scalable Authorization Framework for xApps

Name: E2 IPsec ESP Tunnel
Description: Implemented IPsec ESP tunnel on E2; measured latency and throughput impacts on Colosseum O-RAN testbed. [Testbed]
Reference: Securing O-RAN Open Interfaces

Name: Open Fronthaul MACsec
Description: Configured and evaluated MACsec (with/without encryption) on fronthaul via trace-driven emulation; quantified added delay and throughput effects. [Testbed]
Reference: Securing O-RAN Open Interfaces

Name: RMR Table Hijack
Description: Malicious xApp repeatedly subscribes to E2, hijacking RMR routing and starving legitimate xApps. Demonstrated experimentally. [Testbed]
Affected Components / Interfaces: xApps, Near-RT RIC, O-CU, O-DU, O-RU, UE
Reference: Security Threats to xApps Access Control and E2 Interface in O-RAN

Name: E2 Termination DoS
Description: Malicious xApp sends out-of-order RIC subscription responses, crashing E2 Termination and paralyzing E2 service. Demonstrated experimentally. [Testbed]
Affected Components / Interfaces: E2 Interface, Near-RT RIC, O-CU, O-DU, O-RU, UE
Reference: Security Threats to xApps Access Control and E2 Interface in O-RAN

Name: E2 ARP spoofing MitM
Description: Simulate ARP spoofing on E2 to intercept KPM and disrupt SCTP/E2AP connectivity; demonstrated on srsRAN‚ÄìFlexRIC testbed. [Testbed]
Target Components / Interfaces: Near-RT RIC, O-CU, O-DU, E2 Interface
Affected Components / Interfaces: E2 Interface, Near-RT RIC, O-CU, O-DU
Reference: Simulation of an ARP Spoofing Attack on the E2 Interface in Open RAN

Name: E2 IPsec automation
Description: Automated configuration of O-RAN-compliant IPsec over E2; open-source tool. [Code]
Reference: TRACTOR: Traffic Analysis and Classification Tool for Open RAN

Name: KPI de-identification
Description: Preprocess KPIs to remove identifiers and admin data to ensure user privacy. [Code]
Reference: TRACTOR: Traffic Analysis and Classification Tool for Open RAN

Name: ZTRAN Authentication xApp
Description: Layered MFA verifies UE, RAN, and E2 identifiers via E2; denies unauthorized access; validated on OAIC with denied UE. [Testbed]
Reference: ZTRAN: Prototyping Zero Trust Security xApps for Open Radio Access Network Deployments

Name: ZTRAN Intrusion Detection xApp
Description: Behavior profiling from KPMs over E2 flags anomalies (e.g., flooding); false positives drop with more reports; evaluated on OAIC. [Testbed]
Reference: ZTRAN: Prototyping Zero Trust Security xApps for Open Radio Access Network Deployments

Name: ZTRAN Secure Slicing xApp
Description: Isolates flagged UEs by reconfiguring slices via E2 to O-DU, throttling malicious traffic and protecting legitimate performance. [Testbed]
Target Components / Interfaces: Near-RT RIC, O-DU, E2 Interface, O-RU, UE
Reference: ZTRAN: Prototyping Zero Trust Security xApps for Open Radio Access Network Deployments

Name: A1 MitM via ARP Poisoning
Description: Execute ARP poisoning to intercept and modify A1 policies between controllers in O-RAN SC Release E. [Testbed]
Target Components / Interfaces: Non-RT RIC, Near-RT RIC, A1 Interface
Affected Components / Interfaces: Non-RT RIC, Near-RT RIC, A1 Interface
Reference: Impact of Man-in-the-Middle Attacks to the O-RAN Inter-Controllers Interface

Name: A1 PolicyID Confusion Overwrite
Description: Forge A1 policy with existing PolicyID to overwrite Near-RT RIC policy and desynchronize controllers' states. [Testbed]
Reference: Impact of Man-in-the-Middle Attacks to the O-RAN Inter-Controllers Interface

Name: FRONTSTORM Re-selection Storm
Description: Swapping RU MACs to steer cells, forcing RLF and re-selection; >1400 CU messages/min with 4 UEs. [Testbed]
Reference: On the Criticality of Integrity Protection in 5G Fronthaul Networks

Name: FRONTSTORM Handover Storm
Description: I/Q multiplexing and scaling to flip signal quality, triggering rapid handovers; >2500 CU messages/min with 4 UEs. [Testbed]
Reference: On the Criticality of Integrity Protection in 5G Fronthaul Networks

Name: FRONTSTRIKE Payload Corruption
Description: Replace I/Q payloads to induce errors; throughput drops up to 76% DL and 85% UL at 150 pkts/s. [Testbed]
Reference: On the Criticality of Integrity Protection in 5G Fronthaul Networks

Name: SSB Spoof via Wrong PCI
Description: Modify downlink SSB to wrong PCI; new UEs cannot attach and existing UEs detach. [Testbed]
Reference: On the Criticality of Integrity Protection in 5G Fronthaul Networks

Name: PRACH Corruption Attack
Description: Corrupt uplink PRACH; blocks new UE attachments while existing UEs remain connected. [Testbed]
Reference: On the Criticality of Integrity Protection in 5G Fronthaul Networks

Name: MACsec Integrity for Fronthaul
Description: Benchmark shows AES-NI MACsec adds ~2.4 ¬µs, acceptable for fronthaul; recommend making integrity mandatory. [Testbed]
Reference: On the Criticality of Integrity Protection in 5G Fronthaul Networks

Name: ORANalyst testing framework
Description: End-to-end framework combining static and dynamic analysis to test O-RAN; evaluated on two RICs, finding 19 issues. [Code]
Reference: ORANalyst: Systematic Testing Framework for Open RAN Implementations

Name: Dynamic dependency tracing
Description: Collects execution and network traces to derive component dependency chains and entry/exit points for each message. [Code]
Reference: ORANalyst: Systematic Testing Framework for Open RAN Implementations

Name: RIC DoS via crafted E2 messages
Description: Demonstrates malicious RAN inputs crashing RIC components (e.g. E2T via E2SetupRequest) causing DoS. [Testbed]
Reference: ORANalyst: Systematic Testing Framework for Open RAN Implementations

Name: Indication stream blockage attack
Description: Shows gRPC stream error-handling flaw blocks xApps‚Äô processing, disabling communications indefinitely. [Testbed]
Reference: ORANalyst: Systematic Testing Framework for Open RAN Implementations

Name: Attack Detection xApp
Description: CNN-based xApp detects DDoS in real time and flags attacker IPs; validated on live 5G testbed. [Testbed]
Reference: xApps for DDoS Attacks Detection and Mitigation in 5G-V2X O-RAN Networks

Name: Resource Control xApp
Description: xApp dynamically reallocates radio resources to throttle attacker bandwidth after detection; maintains legitimate users‚Äô service; shown in prototype. [Testbed]
Reference: xApps for DDoS Attacks Detection and Mitigation in 5G-V2X O-RAN Networks

Name: PTP Spoofing Attack
Description: Spoofed Announce messages hijack BMCA master; triggers RU crash and gNB outage; shown on production and twin networks. [Testbed]
Reference: TIMESAFE: Timing Interruption Monitoring and Security Assessment for Fronthaul Environments

Name: PTP Replay Attack
Description: Captures and delays Sync/FollowUp; replays to inflate offset/delay; severely disrupts synchronization; evaluated on digital twin traces. [Testbed]
Reference: TIMESAFE: Timing Interruption Monitoring and Security Assessment for Fronthaul Environments

Name: TIMESAFE ML Detection
Description: Transformer-based monitoring on DU detects PTP attacks with ‚â•97.5% accuracy; validated on production and twin environments. [Testbed]
Reference: TIMESAFE: Timing Interruption Monitoring and Security Assessment for Fronthaul Environments

Name: NDT Security Architecture
Description: O-RAN NDT with security data collector, models, and management to train ML defenses and send policy updates; exercised in emulation. [Testbed]
Target Components / Interfaces: A1 Interface, O1 Interface, O2 Interface, E2 Interface, Near-RT RIC, Non-RT RIC
Reference: Federated Learning for Anomaly Detection in Open RAN: Security Architecture Within a Digital Twin

Name: Hierarchical FL Anomaly Detector
Description: Two-level FL (Near-RT and Non-RT RIC) LSTM classifier for slice anomaly detection
Reference: Federated Learning for Anomaly Detection in Open RAN: Security Architecture Within a Digital Twin

Name: UDP Poisson DDoS
Description: Simulated UDP DDoS using Poisson arrivals and Normal packet sizes to create anomalous traffic. [Testbed]
Reference: Federated Learning for Anomaly Detection in Open RAN: Security Architecture Within a Digital Twin

Name: Bandwidth Hog Attack
Description: Mimics realistic arrivals but inflates payloads to congest network; generates stealthy anomalies. [Testbed]
Reference: Federated Learning for Anomaly Detection in Open RAN: Security Architecture Within a Digital Twin

Name: SleeperNets multi-KPM backdoor
Description: Extends SleeperNets to poison multiple KPIs concurrently; implemented via MultiValuePoison; evaluated on O-RAN dataset. [Code]
Reference: How to Poison an xApp: Dissecting Backdoor Attacks to Deep Reinforcement Learning in Open Radio Access Networks

Name: SleeperNets O-RAN offline poisoning
Description: Applies SleeperNets backdoor poisoning to DRL xApps for PRB allocation; achieves >0.9 attack success on O-RAN dataset. [Code]
Reference: How to Poison an xApp: Dissecting Backdoor Attacks to Deep Reinforcement Learning in Open Radio Access Networks

Name: 5G-Muffler-1
Description: MITM on O-FH C/U plane alters PRACH Msg1 IQ samples to block random access; validated on commercial O-RAN. [Testbed]
Reference: 5G-Muffler: Covert DoS Attacks over Open Fronthaul Interface of O-RAN 5G Network

Name: 5G-Muffler-2
Description: Compromised O-RU injects fake/strong preambles or exploits exponent to suppress detection, DoSing shared cell; validated on FlexRAN-based O-DU. [Testbed]
Reference: 5G-Muffler: Covert DoS Attacks over Open Fronthaul Interface of O-RAN 5G Network

Name: O-FH switch access hardening
Description: Harden access control on O-FH switch to prevent unauthorized manipulation. [Theory]
Reference: 5G-Muffler: Covert DoS Attacks over Open Fronthaul Interface of O-RAN 5G Network

Name: UE Risk Analysis xApp
Description: Classifies UE use cases and scores risk via scaled-deviation boundaries and threat-weighted distances; demonstrated with Ofcom data and alpha sweep. [Code]
Reference: Detection of UE Metric Data Poisoning in O-RAN: Automated Risk Analysis and Resilience

Name: xApp Misbehaviour Detection
Description: Monitors Near-RT RIC xApp traffic in real time, scoring deviations and triggering alerts or isolation of misbehaving xApps. [Theory]
Reference: Detection of UE Metric Data Poisoning in O-RAN: Automated Risk Analysis and Resilience

Name: Resilience Management rApp
Description: Automates redeployment of misbehaving xApps using Non-RT RIC and O-Cloud resources via O1/O2; zero-touch commissioning to maintain availability. [Theory]
Target Components / Interfaces: Non-RT RIC, O1 Interface, O2 Interface, O-Cloud, xApps
Reference: Detection of UE Metric Data Poisoning in O-RAN: Automated Risk Analysis and Resilience

Name: E2 Subscription Flood DoS
Description: Malicious xApp floods Near-RT RIC with E2 subscription requests, causing crashes or blocking connections; validated on FlexRIC and OSC [Testbed].
Reference: Endless Subscriptions: Open RAN is Open to RIC E2 Subscription Denial of Service Attacks

Name: E2 IPsec Encryption
Description: Add IPsec to E2 and empirically measure delay and throughput; delay <50 Œºs, throughput CPU-limited using iperf3 and ping. [Testbed]
Target Components / Interfaces: E2 Interface, Near-RT RIC, O-CU, O-DU
Reference: Implementing and Evaluating Security in O-RAN: Interfaces, Intelligence, and Platforms

Name: C&W Attack xApp
Description: Malicious xApp perturbs KPI data via C&W to evade detector; accuracy falls to 16% on testbed. [Testbed]
Reference: Mitigating ML-Driven Adversarial Attacks on xApps Using Dynamic Defense Mechanisms

Name: BIM Attack xApp
Description: Malicious xApp applies BIM perturbations to KPI data; drops detector accuracy to about 10% on testbed. [Testbed]
Reference: Mitigating ML-Driven Adversarial Attacks on xApps Using Dynamic Defense Mechanisms

Name: HybxLSTM xApp detection
Description: Hybrid xLSTM+Conv with XGBoost detects backdoor attacks; evaluated on TON IoT and deployed as a Near-RT RIC xApp. [Testbed]
Reference: Hybxlstm: a hybrid xLSTM-XGBoost model for securing O-RAN against backdoor attacks

Name: E2 protection xApp
Description: Near-RT RIC xApp protecting E2 at layer 2 via static ARP, duplicate-MAC detection, cache deletion, blocking, restoration; validated on VM testbed within 0.2s. [Testbed]
Reference: Integration of the Layer 2 Protection Extended Application for Open Ran: A Security by Design Approach

Name: ARP spoofing on E2 interface
Description: Simulated ARP spoofing MitM to eavesdrop KPM and disable IP forwarding, disrupting E2 packet reception in VM testbed. [Testbed]
Reference: Integration of the Layer 2 Protection Extended Application for Open Ran: A Security by Design Approach
